title: Immunization Delivery in Pharmacy Settings
cleaned_text: Health Care Provider Resources [Contact Info](#) Infectious Disease Epidemiology, Prevention and Control Division 651-201-5414 Contact Info Infectious Disease Epidemiology, Prevention and Control Division 651-201-5414 Last Updated: 11/22/2022 Immunization Delivery in Pharmacy Settings Below are resources specific to pharmacists. For general guidance, see [Immunization Best Practices](/people/immunize/hcp/bestpractices.html). [Minnesota Board of Pharmacy: General FAQs](https://mn.gov/boards/pharmacy/resourcesfaqs/faqs/generalfaqs.jsp) Under the Immunizations category, find guidance on pharmacists' legal requirements for providing vaccines. [APhA Pharmacy-Based Immunization Delivery Certification](https://www.pharmacist.com/Education/Certificate-Training-Programs/Immunization) [University of Minnesota College of Pharmacy Immunization Delivery for Pharmacists](https://www.pharmacy.umn.edu/degrees-and-programs/continuing-pharmacy-education/continuing-pharmacy-education-courses/immunization-delivery-pharmacists) Both the American Pharmacists Association (APhA) and the University of Minnesota College of Pharmacy offer ACPE (Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education) accredited courses. [Minnesota Pharmacists Association (MPhA)](https://www.mpha.org/default.aspx) [Minnesota Society of Health-System Pharmacists (MSHP)](https://www.mnshp.org/default.aspx) Connect to professional pharmacy organizations for immunization educational opportunities. [MIIC and Pharmacies](/people/immunize/miic/participate/pharmacy.html) Minnesota law requires pharmacists to use MIIC to assess patient immunization status before giving any immunizations, except for influenza if given to patients nine years and older. Pharmacists are also required to fulfill their immunization reporting requirement by reporting all administered vaccine doses to MIIC. MIIC is a confidential, computerized system that collects immunization records for Minnesota residents across the lifespan. MIIC combines immunizations a patient has received into a single record, even if the shots were given by different health care providers in the state. MIIC makes it easy for pharmacies to ensure their patients are up-to-date on their immunizations and that patient immunization records are complete and accurate.
